text: Ray is more than a building. It's a place. Anchoring the historic intersection of 125th Street and Fifth Avenue in the heart of Harlem, Ray Harlem combines modern living with hospitality flourishes, offering apartments designed to optimize light and expansive views of lower Manhattan. Designed by award-winning Frida Escobedo in collaboration with Handel Architects, Ray Harlem comprises 15 stories atop 27, 000 square feet of space owned and operated by the National Black Theater (NBT). From the studios to the two-bedrooms, every apartment at Ray Harlem is thoughtfully designed, including: Quartz Countertops Blonde Oak Floors Oversized Windows Washer / Dryers Nest Smart Thermostat Pet Friendly Custom Resident App At Ray Harlem, stunning apartments sit atop community amenity spaces with a point of view: 24/7 Attended Lobby Living Room Fitness Studio Yoga Studio Coworking w/ Private Workspace Library, curated by Phaidon Press Multiple Outdoor Spaces, including the Park Terrace, Courtyard, and Rooftop Terrace with Outdoor Grilling Stations Rooftop Lounge Communal Kitchen Ray x Tulu Smart Vending Machine Centrally located in Harlem just one block north of Marcus Garvey Park, our connectivity is unmatched, with major subway lines just steps away: 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6. Additionally, the Metro North 125th station provides easy access to the Hudson, Harlem & New Haven lines. Ray Harlem offers an array of unique events, encouraging residents to engage with each other through arts & culture experiences. Ray and the National Black Theatre (NBT) are partners in the redevelopment of the site that has been home to NBT since its founding in 1968. Designed by Marvel Architects, NBT's spaces consist of a 250-seat immersive technology performance space, a 99-seat flexible studio theater, rehearsal rooms, offices, classrooms, and a set-building shop to support workforce development in theatrical trades. Schedule your tour today to experience life at Ray Harlem. Photos and renderings are representative and may not reflect the exact apartment. text: Bright & Airy 2BD in Prime Red Hook Welcome to your sun-drenched sanctuary in the heart of highly coveted Red Hook, Brooklyn. This charming two-bedroom apartment is located just one flight up in a well-maintained building and offers the perfect blend of comfort, style, and convenience. Bathed in natural light from an abundance of windows, the home features gleaming hardwood floors throughout and a recently renovated bathroom with sleek, modern finishes. The spacious primary bedroom boasts three large windows and two generous closets-providing both brightness and ample storage. Tucked away on a quiet, tree-lined street, you're still just moments from Red Hook's vibrant waterfront, local boutiques, cozy caf s, and some of Brooklyn's most beloved restaurants. A true hidden gem along the waterfront, Red Hook blends artistic spirit, community warmth, and industrial charm. With cobblestone streets, sweeping harbor views, and a thriving network of small businesses, it's no surprise this neighborhood is one of Brooklyn's most desirable destinations. Whether you're grabbing a casual sandwich or dining with a view, Red Hook offers a one-of-a-kind culinary experience. Favorites include Red Hook Tavern, Hometown Bar-B-Que, Fort Defiance, Brooklyn Crab, The Good Fork, and Steve's Authentic Key Lime Pies. If you're seeking a serene retreat with charm in one of Brooklyn's most dynamic enclaves-this is it.

text: ARC has abandoned the typical cookie cutter approach to building and taken a fresh look at how today's New Yorkers live, work, and engage with their community. The result is a residential building unlike any other. ARC's residences have been curated for urbanites with an appreciation for design and authenticity, featuring high ceilings and expansive floor-to-ceiling industrial windows showcasing views of the Manhattan skyline and the tranquil interior park. Interior finishes include custom kitchens with quartz countertops and Bosch appliances and beautifully appointed bathrooms with custom brass fixtures and Restoration Hardware accessories. Each residence features digitally programmable thermostats and in-wall HVAC for ultimate climate control as well as Bosch washers and dryers. At ARC, the home experience doesn't end within the four walls of the apartment. With the largest lifestyle-driven amenity program in New York, ARC has over 50,000 square feet of unparalleled amenities that can be incorporated into any lifestyle, including: Rooftop Pool Club featuring a 70' long salt water pool with sundeck, lounges, barbecues, and dining areas Tranquil half-acre interior park Greenhouse for year-round gardening and events 5,000 square foot, state-of-the-art Fitness Center Yoga studio, spin studio, and a private workout studio Dedicated outdoor exercise space Residents lounge Gourmet catering kitchen with private dining Library Collaborative and private work space Basketball court Golf simulator with 15 course options Game room with vintage arcade games and more Indoor bike storage 24-hour attended lobby concierge Valet with dry-cleaning, laundry, and apartment cleaning services On-site Lifestyle Director On-site indoor valet parking garage accessible directly from the building Associated Costs and Fees: -Residents are responsible for electric and cable/internet -Amenities are complimentary with the exception of the fitness center and rooftop pool -Memberships for the fitness center and rooftop pool are optional -Fitness center is $60 monthly per resident; Rooftop Pool is a $250 season pass per resident -On-site garage is managed by LAZ Parking; please contact LAZ Parking for information on rates. -Bike storage is available at $20 monthly -Storage lockers of variable size are available starting at $55 monthly -$20 application fee per applicant; First and 1 Month's Security Deposit due upon lease signing -Third-party lease guaranty services are accepted

The kitchen is finished with wood cabinetry, white Ceasarstone counters, stainless steel gas-range and over-stove microwave, integrated Miele Dishwasher and integrated refrigerator. As part of the open concept kitchen there is a peninsula with breakfast bar allowing the kitchen to blend seamlessly into the main living space, there is room for a dining table and plenty of wall space to accommodate furniture and art. The spacious master bedroom features an en-suite bathroom with a glass-enclosed shower, over-sized mirrored vanity for storage and a heated towel bar. The second bedroom is located on the opposite side of the apartment, enjoys a large closet, treetop views and situated next to the second full bathroom. Washer & Dryer may be added, as the hook-ups for in-unit laundry are already in place. The Marx features a virtual doorman system, key-fob entry, laundry room, building lounge, beautiful roof-deck with grill. Bike storage, storage cages and a parking garage are located on-site and can be rented based on availability. Located equal distance from the building the N/W at 36 Ave. & M/R at Steinway St. make subway access very convenient. Exquisite Living Spaces Our thoughtfully designed apartments range from cozy studios to spacious two-bedroom units, each crafted with meticulous attention to detail. Ideally situated amidst Manhattan's world-class cultural institutions, fine dining, and luxury shopping, this home combines serene living with unparalleled convenience. Step inside to a tranquil, sun-drenched entrance gallery that flows seamlessly into a corner living and dining room. Framed by floor-to-ceiling glass, this space showcases sweeping open city views to the north and east, creating an atmosphere of light and sophistication. Beautiful white-lacquer custom cabinetry provides abundant storage, while generous counter space makes cooking and entertaining a pleasure. The corner primary suite is a private retreat featuring a large, windowed walk-in closet and a spa-like oversized bathroom with a deep soaking tub and separate walk-in shower. A beautifully appointed powder room, dramatic high ceilings, Brazilian cherrywood floors in pristine condition, central air conditioning, and an in-unit washer/dryer complete the home's thoughtful design and modern comforts. Park Avenue Place is an impeccably managed, white-glove condominium offering a full suite of luxury services, including a 24-hour doorman, concierge, live-in resident manager, and a dedicated staff of handymen and porters. Fitness center in building. text: Welcome to 40 East 61st Street, Apartment 18. Completely private, this 2, 836sf full-floor oasis - complete with 4 bedrooms, 4.5 bathrooms and 4 balconies - delivers the unique combination of luxury, privacy, and an abundance of space. A large corner great room is a designer's delight and features a wood burning fireplace, Western and Southern exposures, and a private balcony - one of four throughout the home. A gorgeous dual-entry open kitchen has sliding glass doors to create an airy and welcoming space for cooking and entertaining. The kitchen is equipped with a center island, a La Cornue stove, in-fridge Miele espresso machine, wine fridge, and recessed lighting. A powder room is conveniently located adjacent to the beautiful kitchen. The primary suite is quietly tucked on the north end of the home, featuring a large dressing area, as well as a separate walk-in closet and dressing room, and an en-suite windowed 5-fixture marble bathroom. Beautiful large glass doors open to a private balcony over East 61st Street. A sliding door creates a separate private and purposeful wing for the two secondary bedrooms - both of which are well-proportioned, have wall-to-wall carpeting, built-in desks, and plenty of closet space. Each bedroom has an en-suite bath, one of which is windowed with heated floors. Quietly tucked behind the kitchen in its own corner of the apartment is the 4th bedroom which is currently used as a home office. It too has its own balcony and full ensuite windowed bath, with a separate entrance into the private vestibule. The home is equipped with automatic shades, a smart closet, hardwood flooring, recessed lighting, in-unit washer / dryer, and an abundance of closet space. 40 East 61st Street is a pre-war doorman condominium with a live-in super. On a prime block in the Upper East Side, 40 East 61st Street is conveniently located just minutes from Central Park, cafes, restaurants, high-end shopping and accessible transportation. No pets allowed. First month's rent and one month security deposit are due with signed leases. text: Ray is more than a building. It's a place. Anchoring the historic intersection of 125th Street and Fifth Avenue in the heart of Harlem, Ray Harlem combines modern living with hospitality flourishes, offering apartments designed to optimize light and expansive views of lower Manhattan. Designed by award-winning Frida Escobedo in collaboration with Handel Architects, Ray Harlem comprises 15 stories atop 27,000 square feet of space owned and operated by the National Black Theater (NBT). From the studios to the two-bedrooms, every apartment at Ray Harlem is thoughtfully designed, including: Quartz Countertops Blonde Oak Floors Oversized Windows Washer / Dryers Nest Smart Thermostat Custom Resident App At Ray Harlem, stunning apartments sit atop community amenity spaces with a point of view: 24/7 Attended Lobby Living Room Fitness Studio Yoga Studio Coworking w/ Private Workspace Library, curated by Phaidon Press Multiple Outdoor Spaces, including the Park Terrace, Courtyard, and Rooftop Terrace with Outdoor Grilling Stations Rooftop Lounge Communal Kitchen Ray x Tulu Smart Vending Machine Centrally located in Harlem just one block north of Marcus Garvey Park, our connectivity is unmatched, with major subway lines just steps away: 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6. Additionally, the Metro North 125th station provides easy access to the Hudson, Harlem & New Haven lines. Ray Harlem offers an array of unique events, encouraging residents to engage with each other through arts & culture experiences. Ray and the National Black Theatre (NBT) are partners in the redevelopment of the site that has been home to NBT since its founding in 1968. Designed by Marvel Architects, NBT's spaces consist of a 250-seat immersive technology performance space, a 99-seat flexible studio theater, rehearsal rooms, offices, classrooms, and a set-building shop to support workforce development in theatrical trades. Schedule your tour today to experience life at Ray Harlem. *Photos and renderings are representative and may not reflect the exact apartment. Tenant Fees & Responsibilities Prospective residents are responsible for the following fees, subject to lease or service agreement terms: Application Fee: $20 per person Security Deposit: 1 month's rent Amenities Fee: $75/month per tenant Pet Rent: $50/month per pet Bike Storage: $25/month per bike Utilities: Rent includes water & gas; residents cover electricity, cable, and internet (3rd-party providers).

Welcome to 1998 Second Avenue, an amenity-rich, conveniently located, and competitively priced new 12 story, 164 unit luxury rental building. 1998 offers studios to three-bedroom residences that are designed by award-winning GF55 Architects. All homes feature large windows, quartz kitchen countertops with Bosch and Blomberg appliances, bathrooms with large walk-in, rain head showers with Kohler and Grohe fixtures, as well as in-unit LG washers and dryers. Select apartments offer oversized, private outdoor terraces. Every residence comes with a free storage unit including a bike rack. 1998 has exceptional 5 star amenities, including a 2,000-square-foot lounge with floor-to-ceiling windows with a bar, fireplace and large screen television on the 12th floor, opening through folding glass doors to a 3500 sq. ft. roofdeck with stunning views of the east river and surrounding neighborhood, as well as a swimming pool, 17-foot LED TV, and BBQ areas with table seating. Also featured is a state-of-the art fitness center and an intimate separate media screening room. 1998 has a 24-hour attended lobby and is a pet-friendly building. Situated in one of New York City's (NYC) most exciting neighborhoods, 1998 is just a short walk from the East River Greenway to the east and Central Park to the west. The building is nearby various public transportation access points including the 6 train at 103rd Street and Lexington and the Q train at 96th street on the new Second Avenue subway line, as well as multiple bus lines. The development is also close to major points of interest and NYC staples such as Patsy's Pizzeria, Rao's, El Museo del Barrio, the Museum of the City of New York. The Baltic Canal is a design-forward, boutique building offering residents a full suite of amenities: an attended lobby, a modern fitness center, residents' lounge, co-working space, children's playroom, bike storage, and a stunning rooftop terrace with skyline views. Situated at the crossroads of Boerum Hill, Gowanus, and Park Slope, you're moments from Whole Foods, the F/G/R subway lines, and some of Brooklyn's best coffee shops, restaurants, galleries, and green spaces. text: BRAND NEW RENOVATION! 2 Bedroom / 1.5 Bathroom, apartment 13D features: - 2 queen sized bedrooms - 1.5 bathrooms both impress with marble tile walls & floors and chrome fixtures - Kitchen features Quartz counter tops and stainless steel appliances - Generous closet space - Washer and dryer in unit - Recessed high hat lighting throughout - 5 inch oak flooring - Air Conditioning units provided *Convenience* At The Buchanan, youll enjoy the convenience of a 24/7 concierge, on-site management, and a live-in super. Our package locker and secure mail room make deliveries a breeze and our laundry room in the basement is available for your convenience. *Dermot Ignite Club and Community* When youre ready to unwind, enjoy the benefits of a Dermot property exclusive - Dermot Ignite, a vibrant, socially interactive community. Enjoy specially crafted events like the Summer Concert Series, which takes place every Thursday during the summer months and provides our residents with performances from local musicians across a variety of genres. Additionally, Dermot Ignite offers cocktail mixology classes, wellness sessions, happy hours, and more all managed in-house by top professionals. Plus, every amenity area is equipped with free Wi-Fi. Discover a lifestyle that is rich with engaging activities and connectivity at The Buchanan! *Dermot Ignite Fit* The Dermot Ignite Fit facility features cardio and strength studios where you will find top-of-the-line equipment with free weights up to 100lbs, a squatting rack, a cycling studio, a rowing machine, ellipticals, treadmills, and more. Dermot Ignite offers weekly fitness programming for our residents to connect and stay active. *Dermot Ignite Lounge* The Dermot Ignite lounge is the perfect place to work, unwind, and gather with friends and neighbors. Whether its staying productive on the large, booth-style work tables during the day or catching a game on the big screen in the evening, our cozy residents lounge extends the comforts of your Buchanan home. *The Central Courtyard* Blending pre-war architecture with contemporary styling, The Buchanans large, private courtyard is the perfect spot for working from home in the fresh air, getting to know your neighbors, or enjoying exclusive Dermot Ignite events. *Dermot Ignite Dog Spa* To ensure both you and your pet feel at home at the Buchanan, we have a fully stocked washing station for use whenever its time to get your pup fresh and clean. *Our Neighborhood* The Buchanan is set in the heart of Turtle Bay, a classic Manhattan neighborhood tucked between the East River and Midtown. Rich in history, it is home to the United Nations, the Chrysler Building, and Grand Central Terminal, among other internationally recognized icons. Just a few blocks from the energy of the Midtown business district, Turtle Bays residential streets are filled with a variety of upscale restaurants and lounges and bordered by a lush waterfront park. All parts of the city and tri-state region are accessible via nearby subways and trains. With prime Midtown just a few blocks away, many of the citys premier corporate towers and luxury shopping destinations are close at hand. *3D tour and pictures are from a similar unit and representative of the finishes.*

text: Ray is more than a building. It's a place. Anchoring the historic intersection of 125th Street and Fifth Avenue in the heart of Harlem, Ray Harlem combines modern living with hospitality flourishes, offering apartments designed to optimize light and expansive views of lower Manhattan. Designed by award-winning Frida Escobedo in collaboration with Handel Architects, Ray Harlem comprises 15 stories atop 27, 000 square feet of space owned and operated by the National Black Theater (NBT). From the studios to the two-bedrooms, every apartment at Ray Harlem is thoughtfully designed, including: Quartz Countertops Blonde Oak Floors Oversized Windows Washer / Dryers Nest Smart Thermostat Pet Friendly Custom Resident App At Ray Harlem, stunning apartments sit atop community amenity spaces with a point of view: 24/7 Attended Lobby Living Room Fitness Studio Yoga Studio Coworking w/ Private Workspace Library, curated by Phaidon Press Multiple Outdoor Spaces, including the Park Terrace, Courtyard, and Rooftop Terrace with Outdoor Grilling Stations Rooftop Lounge Communal Kitchen Ray x Tulu Smart Vending Machine Centrally located in Harlem just one block north of Marcus Garvey Park, our connectivity is unmatched, with major subway lines just steps away: 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6. Additionally, the Metro North 125th station provides easy access to the Hudson, Harlem & New Haven lines. Ray Harlem offers an array of unique events, encouraging residents to engage with each other through arts & culture experiences. Ray and the National Black Theatre (NBT) are partners in the redevelopment of the site that has been home to NBT since its founding in 1968. Designed by Marvel Architects, NBT's spaces consist of a 250-seat immersive technology performance space, a 99-seat flexible studio theater, rehearsal rooms, offices, classrooms, and a set-building shop to support workforce development in theatrical trades. This striking building, rich in history and adorned with copper patina, tells a story of craftsmanship and careoriginally built by a father, now meticulously restored and reimagined by his son. A new chapter begins, blending classic architectural beauty with modern comforts to create a home where legacy meets possibility. Step inside this expansive one-bedroom, one-bathroom residence, where natural light floods through oversized bay windows, illuminating original details that have been thoughtfully preserved. text: Ray is more than a building. It's a place. Anchoring the historic intersection of 125th Street and Fifth Avenue in the heart of Harlem, Ray Harlem combines modern living with hospitality flourishes, offering apartments designed to optimize light and expansive views of lower Manhattan. Designed by award-winning Frida Escobedo in collaboration with Handel Architects, Ray Harlem comprises 15 stories atop 27,000 square feet of space owned and operated by the National Black Theater (NBT). From the studios to the two-bedrooms, every apartment at Ray Harlem is thoughtfully designed, including: Quartz Countertops Blonde Oak Floors Oversized Windows Washer / Dryers Nest Smart Thermostat Custom Resident App At Ray Harlem, stunning apartments sit atop community amenity spaces with a point of view: 24/7 Attended Lobby Living Room Fitness Studio Yoga Studio Coworking w/ Private Workspace Library, curated by Phaidon Press Multiple Outdoor Spaces, including the Park Terrace, Courtyard, and Rooftop Terrace with Outdoor Grilling Stations Rooftop Lounge Communal Kitchen Ray x Tulu Smart Vending Machine Centrally located in Harlem just one block north of Marcus Garvey Park, our connectivity is unmatched, with major subway lines just steps away: 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6. Additionally, the Metro North 125th station provides easy access to the Hudson, Harlem & New Haven lines. Ray Harlem offers an array of unique events, encouraging residents to engage with each other through arts & culture experiences. Ray and the National Black Theatre (NBT) are partners in the redevelopment of the site that has been home to NBT since its founding in 1968. Designed by Marvel Architects, NBT's spaces consist of a 250-seat immersive technology performance space, a 99-seat flexible studio theater, rehearsal rooms, offices, classrooms, and a set-building shop to support workforce development in theatrical trades. text: Experience a charming apartment in the heart of the Upper East Side on East 94th Street between 1st and 2nd Ave in a walk-up building. Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families, this apartment is just steps from the Q subway station, Central Park, and the Guggenheim Museum. Discover designer stores and immerse yourself in the vibrant neighborhood, embracing the allure of the Upper East Side's prime location. Welcome to a spacious apartment that offers comfort and convenience. This delightful unit features two separate bedrooms, a cozy living room with a dining area and a sofa bed, a bathroom, and a fully equipped kitchen. In the inviting living room, you'll find a comfortable sofa that can be converted into an additional bed if needed, providing extra sleeping space for guests. Gather around the dining table and chairs in the living room's dining area to enjoy meals together comfortably. The fully equipped kitchen includes appliances such as a toaster, microwave, oven, electric kettle, fridge/freezer, stove, and an electric plate, ensuring you have everything needed to prepare meals during your stay. Clean linens and towels are provided for your comfort. Both bedrooms are tastefully furnished, with the master bedroom featuring a queen-sized bed and the second bedroom offering a full-sized bed. Each bedroom is equipped with a closet, heating/air conditioning unit, and windows that allow natural light to fill the space. For your entertainment, a flat LCD TV with Roku streaming is available. Utilities such as electricity, gas, Wi-Fi, and streaming Roku TV are not included in the monthly rent and will cost $330 per month, with a rate of $360 per month from June 1st to October 1st. A late check-in fee of $50 applies for arrivals after 10 PM, and $100 for arrivals after midnight. All pets must be approved in advance, with a pet fee ranging from $200 to $300. Additional cleaning can be arranged for a fee. Discover the vibrant neighborhood of the Upper East Side, where convenience and excitement converge. Located on East 94th Street between 1st and 2nd Avenue, this area offers a wealth of highlights just steps away from the apartment. Immerse yourself in a shopper's paradise with renowned designer stores, indulge in a culinary journey at well-known restaurants, or enjoy a night out at nearby cinemas, comedy clubs, and coffee shops. Nature enthusiasts will delight in the proximity to Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum, and the Guggenheim Museum, offering a wealth of cultural experiences and breathtaking landscapes. Convenience is key with amenities like drug stores, nail salons, a US Post Office, FedEx and UPS locations, banks, and more nearby. For groceries, Whole Foods Market and Amazon Hub on East 87th Street and 3rd Avenue are within walking distance. Transportation is a breeze with the Q Second Avenue/Broadway Express subway station just steps away, and the 4, 5, 6 Green Line 86th Street Subway Station and the M15 cross-town bus within walking distance. Experience the perfect blend of accessibility, amenities, and local attractions in this lively neighborhood. To ensure a smooth check-in process, coordinate your arrival time in advance, at least 72 hours prior to check-in. For last-minute bookings, provide advance notice of a few hours. Check-out time is by 11 AM, and before you check out, please empty the refrigerator and throw away all trash. A valid government-issued photo ID is required at check-in for..

Expansive 2 Bed + Home Office / 2.5 Bath home with park and water views in the highly coveted, Robert A.M. Stern-designed, Cortland Condominium. Unit 5DW offers dramatic west-facing vistas overlooking Chelsea Waterside Park's treetops from every room. Upon entry, one is greeted by a large foyer and stunning powder room with precious stone walls and cove lighting. There are two large coat closets for all one's your storage needs, one a double hanging custom-built walk-in closet and the other a long linear closet. Just beyond the entry foyer is an oversized home office which can also be used as a den or children's room. At the end of the long entry hallway, the home opens up into an oversized great room with plenty of space for a large dining area as well as an expansive sitting area. The impeccably-designed chef's kitchen is open to the great room, creating the perfect layout for entertaining. The open kitchen features a large breakfast bar, custom oak cabinetry with abundant storage, marble countertop and backsplash, as well as a full-suite of Gaggenau appliances and wine refrigerator. Both the primary and secondary bedrooms are generously proportioned king-size rooms with en-suite bathrooms. They each offer stunning treetop and sky views. The primary bedroom boasts a massive fully built-out walk-in closet, and an incredible spa-like five fixture bathroom with double vanity, radiant heated marble floors, and abundant storage. There is a large laundry room with an oversized washer and dryer that vent out, as well as custom built-in storage. This apartment has Nest Home Automation system. The attention to detail throughout the home is truly exceptional including marble windowsills, white oak flooring, remote-controlled shades in every room, custom built-in closets, custom vanities and precious stonework in every bathroom. The Cortland Condominium provides the highest level of living along West Chelsea's High Line. Designed by Robert AM Stern and Olson Kundig, the building perfectly marries modern and traditional aesthetics to create Chelsea's crown jewel. There are over 20, 000 SF of amenities including: 24 hour doorman and attended desk, 75 ft lap pool, children's leisure pool, spa, roof deck with Hudson River views and BBQ grills, landscaped courtyard with waterfall, fitness center (with separate studios for cycling, yoga, and pilates), private motor court and garage, game room (ping pong, foosball, and shuffleboard), Sandbox (pottery wheels and 3D printing), two-level children's playroom, squash and basketball courts, virtual reality room, and more.
